title: Acronis backup Guide 2019
text: Acronis True Image 2019 Backup Guide Load up Acronis with your external drive Close out of the above window Once the Acronis external drive is plugged in type the above command in red or where the location for your drive is? i.e. d:/k3.bat or e:/k3.bat or could be straight from the build folder on the network drive, for engineers chances are will be from a external drive working remotely. Select & click on backup Click on Disk and partition Backup your computer Partitions to Backup - Select where to backup will be usual Disk 1 Local Drive Click Next Backup wizard and where to backup files which partitions Click Browse Locate your images where your images are? In this case its (under images folder) - Select your Image to Backup - Target Backup Location Drive (in this case we are backing up a Wasabi image) Click Next Summary of Backup location will ask to proceed a Backup Partition will start to be created Once backup created and completed a box will appear with (waiting for restart)
description:
Acronis True Image 2019 Backup Guide

Load up Acronis with your external drive


Close out of the above window 

 

Once the Acronis external drive is plugged in type the above command in red or where the location for your drive is? i.e. d:/k3.bat or e:/k3.bat or could be straight from the build folder on the network drive, for engineers chances are will be from a external drive working remotely.


Select & click on backup


Click on Disk and partition Backup your computer



Partitions to Backup - Select where to backup will be usual Disk 1 Local Drive


Click Next 

Backup wizard and where to backup files which partitions 


Click Browse 

Locate your images where your images are?  In this case its (under images folder) -



Select your Image to Backup -



Target Backup Location Drive (in this case we are backing up a Wasabi image)

Click Next 


Summary of Backup location will ask to proceed


a Backup Partition will start to be created 


 

 

Once backup created and completed a box will appear with (waiting for restart)

title: Verifone RMA

title: Network Testing
text: Run a Poweshell script with the following txt to write a network Ping to a file Test-Connection -Count 9999 -ComputerName Machine you test | Format-Table @{Name='TimeStamp';Expression={Get-Date}},Address,ProtocolAddress,ResponseTime | tee -file C:\pingtest.txt -append ping -t Machine you test|Foreach{"{0} - {1}" -f (Get-Date),$_} > c:\pingtest.txt You need to enter the hostname or IP of the machine you want to test and also the output file name. By default this is set to the root of c:\
description:
Run a Poweshell script with the following txt to write a network Ping to a file 

 

 

 

Test-Connection -Count 9999 -ComputerName Machine you test | Format-Table @{Name='TimeStamp';Expression={Get-Date}},Address,ProtocolAddress,ResponseTime | tee -file C:\pingtest.txt -append 

 

ping -t Machine you test|Foreach{"{0} - {1}" -f (Get-Date),$_} > c:\pingtest.txt 

 

 

You need to enter the hostname or IP of the machine you want to test and also the output file name. By default this is set to the root of c:\

title: N-Central Remote Access / Monitoring
text: N-Central Remote Access / Monitoring 03 August 2022 10:34 Overview N-Able is a remote monitoring and management automation solution designed to help manage PCs and Networks. It includes tools such as Remote Access, Patch Management, an Anti-virus solution, a Backup and Recovery solution, Network Management and PC Monitoring which the customer pays for. Alternatively for just remote access, we use Team Viewer (which is not chargeable). N-Able is mostly used by the UK and Netherlands teams (where it is installed by the Netherlands hardware/install partner). Please note that this document will only go through certain aspects of N-Able. N-Able is a very large piece of software. It has its own user guide and training videos should you wish to learn more about it Logging in N-Able is a web based system which allows us to logon anywhere. The web address is; https://n-able.k3ssl.com Once on the website you will need to enter your Login Name and Password, then click Login. Once logged in you will be presented with the K3Retail Dashboard. Dashboard Below is a screenshot of the default Dashboard This dashboard is what you will use to navigate your way through N-Able. On the left-hand side, you will see the different Menus available and on the right-hand side you will see the available devices. You can drill into individual customers by clicking on the orange drop down box in the top left corner, allowing you to select a specific customer. This allows you to view devices added to their account and settings specific to them. The standard K3Retail will display all customers devices. When you have selected the customer or found the PC you are looking for then there are several options available. If you click on the Name of the unit then it will allow you to view information without having to connect to the machine by taking you into a Device Details screen. Device Details From the Device Details screen you will be able to see live system information of that Pc. The top of the screen will display some hardware information, like the CPU, disk drive information, RAM and some OS information like the OS version, logged on user, system uptime and CPU/Memory usage. The bottom of the screen will give you several options. Overview will display a basic overview like Active Issues, System Information, Open Ports, Patch Summary, AV protection and certain graphs to help view CPU and Memory usage. Tools will give you multiple options Services  allows you to view services on the machine, start and stop them as well as changing the settings. Processes  allows you to view live information on what processes are running, similar to Task Manager. You can start new and stop processes. Registry  gives you remote access to the registry settings. You can add/modify/delete registry keys Applications  gives you a list of currently installed software on the machine, allowing you to uninstall and patch them. Start-up Applications  allows you to see a list of programs that start-up with Windows. You can enable/disable them. Printers -shows you a list of currently installed Windows Printers. Allows you to delete, set as default and print test pages. Command Prompt  allows you to run command lines remotely File System  allows you to organise the files on the machine. You can send/receive files, move them using Copy/Paste and also delete them. Task Execution  allows you to run tasks based on pre-installed policies and scripts. For instance, you can send a task to do a Defrag or Check Disk. Asset will allow to view different operating system information Hardware Specs Operating System information Installed Applications Shared Folders Patches Services Ports MSSQL Installations Configuration such as purchase dates, warranty dates, lease dates etc Settings will allow you to change settings associated with that device. Given Name  this allows you to name the machine. As default it will use the local PC name but to make things a bit easier you can assign your own name. Network address  allows you to set the IP address instead of PC name. Remoting to a Pc From the main dashboard you will be presented with a screen displaying All Devices currently added to N-Able. From this screen, you can connect to them. You will see each till as above. You will see a Green icon displaying a computer with a signal. If you click on this it will run the MSP Connection screen. Please note  running this for the first time you will be presented with an installation box. This is to install the MSP Connect Viewer Application. Click on the MSP Connect Viewer link in Step 1 to download the application and install it. Once installed you should see the following; Click Ok then click on the Launch MSP Connect button to start the application and connect to the PC. Remote Connection Features There are several features available when connecting to a PC, not only do you have the ability to remotely control the machine but there are additional functions like File Transfer, running Shell commands and viewing PC information. Standard Functions When you first connect to a PC you will see 3 options at the bottom left hand corner of the screen. These are; Computer will give you the option of performing Reboots and Shutdowns Advanced will give you the option of using Port Forwarding or RDP Session will give you the option of start a VOIP call General The General tab will display basic system information such as OS versions, hardware information, network information and Drive information. It also contains the Chat function which will allow you to exchange messages with the user. Remote Desktop The Remote Desktop function should be familiar to most people who have used software to dial into PCs before. You will be able to see the customers screen and control it. There are additional tools you can use when connected. At the bottom you will see a task bar allowing with some of these functions on it. View allows you to change the way you are viewing the computer  change the size, resolution, optimisation choices etc Monitors will allow you to swap between the different monitors attached to the machine Commands will allow you to send different controls to the PC  like CTRL+ALT+DEL, Lock the PC, block remote keyboard/mouse, blank screen or lock the PC. Interactions will allow you to use certain features like a laser pointed on the screen to show the remote user what you are doing, taking screenshots, recording videos, Copy & pasting etc System Shell System Shell will allow you to use standard CMD prompts with Administrator privileges on the machine you are controlling without interacting with the customers screen. For example  you can use this to do IP configs or ping tests etc without bringing up a command prompt on the customers screen. File Transfer File Transfer gives you the ability to copy files to or copy files from the remote PC. You can create new folders, rename them, copy and delete files in the background. System Info System Info will give you the ability to drill into the remove PC, viewing the PC specs, the BIOS versions, hardware information including Drivers, CPU usage, motherboard information, installed updates, services, processes, installed drivers etc, installed applications, User information etc
description:
N-Central Remote Access / Monitoring

03 August 2022

10:34

 

Overview

 

 

N-Able is a remote monitoring and management automation solution designed to help manage PCs and Networks. It includes tools such as Remote Access, Patch Management, an Anti-virus solution, a Backup and Recovery solution, Network Management and PC Monitoring which the customer pays for. Alternatively for just remote access, we use Team Viewer (which is not chargeable).

N-Able is mostly used by the UK and Netherlands teams (where it is installed by the Netherlands hardware/install partner).

Please note that this document will only go through certain aspects of N-Able. N-Able is a very large piece of software. It has its own user guide and training videos should you wish to learn more about it

 

 

Logging in

 

N-Able is a web based system which allows us to logon anywhere. The web address is;

https://n-able.k3ssl.com 

Once on the website you will need to enter your Login Name and Password, then click Login.

 

 

Once logged in you will be presented with the K3Retail Dashboard.

 

Dashboard

 

 

Below is a screenshot of the default Dashboard

 

This dashboard is what you will use to navigate your way through N-Able. On the left-hand side, you will see the different Menus available and on the right-hand side you will see the available devices.

You can drill into individual customers by clicking on the orange drop down box in the top left corner, allowing you to select a specific customer. This allows you to view devices added to their account and settings specific to them. The standard K3Retail will display all customers devices.

When you have selected the customer or found the PC you are looking for then there are several options available.

If you click on the Name of the unit then it will allow you to view information without having to connect to the machine by taking you into a Device Details screen.

 

Device Details

 

From the Device Details screen you will be able to see live system information of that Pc. 

The top of the screen will display some hardware information, like the CPU, disk drive information, RAM and some OS information like the OS version, logged on user, system uptime and CPU/Memory usage.

 

The bottom of the screen will give you several options.

 

Overview will display a basic overview like Active Issues, System Information, Open Ports, Patch Summary, AV protection and certain graphs to help view CPU and Memory usage.

Tools will give you multiple options

    • Services allows you to view services on the machine, start and stop them as well as changing the settings.
    • Processes allows you to view live information on what processes are running, similar to Task Manager. You can start new and stop processes.
    • Registry gives you remote access to the registry settings. You can add/modify/delete registry keys
    • Applications gives you a list of currently installed software on the machine, allowing you to uninstall and patch them.
    • Start-up Applications allows you to see a list of programs that start-up with Windows. You can enable/disable them.
    • Printers -shows you a list of currently installed Windows Printers. Allows you to delete, set as default and print test pages.
    • Command Prompt allows you to run command lines remotely
    • File System allows you to organise the files on the machine. You can send/receive files, move them using Copy/Paste and also delete them.
    • Task Execution allows you to run tasks based on pre-installed policies and scripts. For instance, you can send a task to do a Defrag or Check Disk.

Asset will allow to view different operating system information

    • Hardware Specs
    • Operating System information
    • Installed Applications
    • Shared Folders
    • Patches
    • Services
    • Ports
    • MSSQL Installations
    • Configuration such as purchase dates, warranty dates, lease dates etc

Settings will allow you to change settings associated with that device.

    • Given Name this allows you to name the machine. As default it will use the local PC name but to make things a bit easier you can assign your own name.
    • Network address allows you to set the IP address instead of PC name.

 

Remoting to a Pc

 

 

From the main dashboard you will be presented with a screen displaying All Devices currently added to N-Able. From this screen, you can connect to them.

 

 

You will see each till as above. You will see a Green icon displaying a computer with a signal. If you click on this it will run the MSP Connection screen.

Please note running this for the first time you will be presented with an installation box. This is to install the MSP Connect Viewer Application.

Click on the MSP Connect Viewer link in Step 1 to download the application and install it. Once installed you should see the following;

 

 

 

Click Ok then click on the Launch MSP Connect button to start the application and connect to the PC.

 

Remote Connection Features

 

There are several features available when connecting to a PC, not only do you have the ability to remotely control the machine but there are additional functions like File Transfer, running Shell commands and viewing PC information.

 

Standard Functions

When you first connect to a PC you will see 3 options at the bottom left hand corner of the screen. These are;

    • Computer will give you the option of performing Reboots and Shutdowns
    • Advanced will give you the option of using Port Forwarding or RDP
    • Session will give you the option of start a VOIP call

General

 

The General tab will display basic system information such as OS versions, hardware information, network information and Drive information.

It also contains the Chat function which will allow you to exchange messages with the user.

 

Remote Desktop

 

The Remote Desktop function should be familiar to most people who have used software to dial into PCs before. You will be able to see the customers screen and control it. There are additional tools you can use when connected. At the bottom you will see a task bar allowing with some of these functions on it.

    • View allows you to change the way you are viewing the computer change the size, resolution, optimisation choices etc
    • Monitors will allow you to swap between the different monitors attached to the machine
    • Commands will allow you to send different controls to the PC like CTRL+ALT+DEL, Lock the PC, block remote keyboard/mouse, blank screen or lock the PC.
    • Interactions will allow you to use certain features like a laser pointed on the screen to show the remote user what you are doing, taking screenshots, recording videos, Copy & pasting etc

 

System Shell

 

System Shell will allow you to use standard CMD prompts with Administrator privileges on the machine you are controlling without interacting with the customers screen. 

For example you can use this to do IP configs or ping tests etc without bringing up a command prompt on the customers screen.

 

 

 

 

 

File Transfer

 

File Transfer gives you the ability to copy files to or copy files from the remote PC. You can create new folders, rename them, copy and delete files in the background.

 

 

 

 

System Info

System Info will give you the ability to drill into the remove PC, viewing the PC specs, the BIOS versions, hardware information including Drivers, CPU usage, motherboard information, installed updates, services, processes, installed drivers etc, installed applications, User information etc

title: VeriFone Ocuis Sentinel Known Issues
text: VeriFone Ocuis Sentinel Known Issues 03 August 2022 14:44 Ocius Setup Is Invalid  Re-activation is required When trying to log into Ocius, if you encounter a message saying Activation required, you will need to re-register the account. To do this, firstly make sure Ocius is closed (close from the System Tray), then you will need to delete a registry entry called PED_Ocius which can be found here; 32bit - HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Commidea Ltd 64bit - HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Commidea Ltd If you delete this entry and then re-launch Ocius, it will take you through the activation process again. Accept the Account, login using the customers Login ID and Pin Once this has re-downloaded the customers account, log out and close Ocius from the System Tray, then log in using our integration. Should this fail or continue to error then speak to the Verifone Helpdesk Maximum License Limit Exceeded Should you see this error message when trying to license Ocius, the reason for this is all to do with the amount of license slots we have used. Each PED we use has a license slot, each license slot is used by the Virtual PTID number found under the About tab on Ocius Sentinel. This PTID is linked via the MAC address of the Pc, so should the Pc be swapped this PTID will change, upon changing it will now take a second license slot. Should you see the error Maximum License Limit Exceeded, it is because all the license slots have been used and require the old slots clearing down before you can license the PED. In this instance you will need to contact our Account Manager. If for whatever reason they are not available then contact Verifone Helpdesk on 0844 482 8222 Invalid Pinpad Each terminal has its own unique ID (PTID), these IDs are linked to set accounts. Should the PED not be on that account then it will not allow you to use it. If you see the error message Invalid Pinpad then this could be due to 3 reasons. Reason 1  The pc has had a previous account loaded onto the till. When you try to load sentinel it will say Invalid Pinpad because the previous account does not recognize the new PED. Simply delete the Commidea registry key, close down Ocius and download the new account. 32bit - HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Commidea Ltd 64bit - HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Commidea Ltd Reason 2  the account download has been interrupted. Should the account not download correctly it could display this error  once again simply delete the registry and try again. Reason 3  the Pinpad has not been added to our account. This will be an issue with Verifone so should you run into this problem please speak to our K3RSG Account Manager as arrangements will need to be made for the PED to be added to our account.
description:
VeriFone Ocuis Sentinel Known Issues

03 August 2022

14:44

Ocius Setup Is Invalid Re-activation is required

 

When trying to log into Ocius, if you encounter a message saying Activation required, you will need to re-register the account. To do this, firstly make sure Ocius is closed (close from the System Tray), then you will need to delete a registry entry called PED_Ocius which can be found here;

32bit - HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Commidea Ltd

64bit - HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Commidea Ltd

If you delete this entry and then re-launch Ocius, it will take you through the activation process again. Accept the Account, login using the customers Login ID and Pin 

Once this has re-downloaded the customers account, log out and close Ocius from the System Tray, then log in using our integration. Should this fail or continue to error then speak to the Verifone Helpdesk 

 

 

 

 

Maximum License Limit Exceeded

 

Should you see this error message when trying to license Ocius, the reason for this is all to do with the amount of license slots we have used. Each PED we use has a license slot, each license slot is used by the Virtual PTID number found under the About tab on Ocius Sentinel. This PTID is linked via the MAC address of the Pc, so should the Pc be swapped this PTID will change, upon changing it will now take a second license slot. Should you see the error Maximum License Limit Exceeded, it is because all the license slots have been used and require the old slots clearing down before you can license the PED. In this instance you will need to contact our Account Manager. If for whatever reason they are not available then contact Verifone Helpdesk on 0844 482 8222

 

 

Invalid Pinpad

 

Each terminal has its own unique ID (PTID), these IDs are linked to set accounts. Should the PED not be on that account then it will not allow you to use it. If you see the error message Invalid Pinpad then this could be due to 3 reasons. 

Reason 1 The pc has had a previous account loaded onto the till. When you try to load sentinel it will say Invalid Pinpad because the previous account does not recognize the new PED. Simply delete the Commidea registry key, close down Ocius and download the new account.

32bit - HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Commidea Ltd

64bit - HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Commidea Ltd

Reason 2 the account download has been interrupted. Should the account not download correctly it could display this error once again simply delete the registry and try again. 

Reason 3 the Pinpad has not been added to our account. This will be an issue with Verifone so should you run into this problem please speak to our K3RSG Account Manager as arrangements will need to be made for the PED to be added to our account.

title: Checking TM88 Config is set to USB
text: The command is as follows Turn the printer off Hold the feed button and turn it on  this does the first part of the self-test Instead of pressing the feed button to finish, hold the feed button This will bring you to the first menu  Mode selection Tap feed 3 times, then hold feed  this will take you into Customize Value Settings Tap feed 10 times, then hold feed  this will take you into Interface Selection Tap feed 3 times, then hold feed  this will set the interface to Auto Then hold the feed to go back to the previous menus until you are back at the start.
description:
The command is as follows

 

  • Turn the printer off
  • Hold the feed button and turn it on this does the first part of the self-test
  • Instead of pressing the feed button to finish, hold the feed button
  • This will bring you to the first menu Mode selection
  • Tap feed 3 times, then hold feed this will take you into Customize Value Settings
  • Tap feed 10 times, then hold feed this will take you into Interface Selection
  • Tap feed 3 times, then hold feed this will set the interface to Auto
  • Then hold the feed to go back to the previous menus until you are back at the start.

title: Touchscreen problems
text: Whether the customer can't use the touchscreen at all or if it acts strangely, has touch zones that appear to be continuously touched in one corner, or displays other strange actions, the errors can be caused by that the ELO Touch driver hasn't been installed. Check in the lower right corner if ELO is running, either by clicking the up-arrow or by looking for the ELO icon If you can't find it, try searching for ELO on the PC. If Windows cannot find ELO, it is not installed. Open https://www.elotouch.com/support/downloads#/ Choose Touch Driver and which Windows version the PC is running (check under System Information if you are unsure) Unzip the file Choose language. Tick Install Serial Touchscreen Drivers Accept the License Agreement Tick Auto-detect Elo Touchscreen Usually, the screen is connected to Com5. If the program can't find Com5, choose the most likely Com-port listed (except for Com1-3). You can use Windows Computer Management to check if anything is connected e.g. Com7 (in this case it's a scanner). In this example, choose Com4. Click Next The driver is being installed The PC needs to be restarted after installation is finished. Elo is now installed If you are still on the phone with the customer, you need their help for this next step to calibrate the touchscreen. If not, call them after the installation is complete. Right-click on Elo and choose Align Have to customer tap on the targets (there will usually be 3-4 of them) and then drag their finger around on the screen until the calibration finishes. Now the touchscreen should work normally. If the installation and the calibration doesn't work, there might be something wrong with the screen and they probably need a new one.
description:
Whether the customer can't use the touchscreen at all or if it acts strangely, has touch zones that appear to be continuously touched in one corner, or displays other strange actions, the errors can be caused by that the ELO Touch driver hasn't been installed.

 

  1. Check in the lower right corner if ELO is running, either by clicking the up-arrow or by looking for the ELO icon 


  2. If you can't find it, try searching for ELO on the PC.



  3. If Windows cannot find ELO, it is not installed.

  4. Open https://www.elotouch.com/support/downloads#/

  5. Choose Touch Driver and which Windows version the PC is running (check under System Information if you are unsure)


     
  6. Unzip the file



  7. Choose language.


     
  8. Tick Install Serial Touchscreen Drivers



  9. Accept the License Agreement



  10. Tick Auto-detect Elo Touchscreen



  11. Usually, the screen is connected to Com5.

    If the program can't find Com5, choose the most likely Com-port listed (except for Com1-3). You can use Windows Computer Management to check if anything is connected e.g. Com7 (in this case it's a scanner).


    In this example, choose Com4.



  12. Click Next



  13. The driver is being installed



  14. The PC needs to be restarted after installation is finished.



  15. Elo is now installed



  16. If you are still on the phone with the customer, you need their help for this next step to calibrate the touchscreen. If not, call them after the installation is complete.

  17. Right-click on Elo and choose Align


      
  18. Have to customer tap on the targets (there will usually be 3-4 of them) and then drag their finger around on the screen until the calibration finishes.

  19. Now the touchscreen should work normally.
     
  20. If the installation and the calibration doesn't work, there might be something wrong with the screen and they probably need a new one.
